q: I speak without a mouth and hear without ears. I have nobody, but I come alive with wind. What am I?
The more you take, the more you leave behind. What am I?
I’m always hungry, I must always be fed. The finger I touch will soon turn red. What am I?
What has keys but can’t open locks?
I’m tall when I’m young and short when I’m old. What am I?
I have branches, but no fruit, trunk or leaves. What am I?
What can travel around the world while staying in a corner?
I’m found in socks, scarves and mittens; and often in the paws of playful kittens. What am I?
What has one eye but can’t see?
I shrink smaller every time I take a bath. What am I?
I’m light as a feather, yet the strongest man can’t hold me for long. What am I?
Forward I am heavy, but backward I am not. What am I?
I’m always in front of you, but can’t be seen. What am I?
I can be cracked, made, told, and played. What am I?
I have teeth but can’t bite. What am I?
I’m round on the outside, flat on the inside. What am I?
I have a tongue that cannot taste, and eyes that cannot see. What am I?
I fly without wings. I cry without eyes. Whenever I go, darkness flies. What am I?
I start with an E, end with an E, but contain only one letter. What am I?
I have a heart that doesn’t beat. What am I?
You see a boat filled with people, yet there isn’t a single person on board. How is that possible?
A man dies of old age on his 25th birthday. How is this possible?
A rooster lays an egg on top of a roof. Which way does it roll?
A plane crashes on the border of two countries. Where do they bury the survivors?
A man walks out into the rain without a hat or umbrella and doesn’t get a single hair wet. How?
I am full of holes but can hold water. What am I?
I can fill a room but take up no space. What am I?
I disappear every night but return every morning. What am I?
I am not alive, but I grow; I don’t have lungs, but I need air; I don’t have a mouth, and water kills me. What am I?
The more of me there is, the less you see. What am I?
I have no legs but I run. What am I?
I can be broken but never held. What am I?
I go all around the world but always stay in a corner. What am I?
I have hands but cannot hold anything. What am I?
I am tall when young, short when old. What am I?
I can be long or short, grown or bought, painted or left bare. What am I?
I fly without wings, I cry without eyes. What am I?
I shrink smaller every time I’m used. What am I?
I have eyes but cannot see. What am I?
I go up and down the stairs without moving. What am I?
The more you take away from me, the bigger I get. What am I?
I am always running but never walk. What am I?
I can be long, short, grown, or bought. What am I?
I have a neck but no head, two arms but no hands. What am I?
I disappear every night but return every morning. What am I?
I can be cracked, made, told, and played. What am I?
I have teeth but cannot bite. What am I?
I fly without wings, I cry without eyes. Whenever I go, darkness flies. What am I?
I start with an E, end with an E, but contain only one letter. What am I?
I have a heart that doesn’t beat. What am I?
